intro: Rabdosia macrophylla f. qingliangfenensis, commonly known as the Qingliangfen mountain rabdosia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, purple flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
